creditline: Gift of Mary and Bob Mersky
description: rounded body with very wide, bulbous, outward-flaring neck, with two outward-flaring rings at top mouth opening; human facial features applied to neck; applied thin abstracted arms, hands and navel on body of vessel; round O-shaped open mouth, pointed nose, round eyes, C-shaped ears; PL hand on chin; incised patterning beneath arms, on upper back and on back of head; stamped star or flower designs on chest and around neck; brown patina
text: With slightly porous walls that enable a certain amount of liquid to evaporate, this spectacular pot keeps its contents nice and cool. That is of great advantage to the drinkers of the beer that this kind of vessel used to store. Made by the Mambila people along the border between Nigeria and Cameroon, the face of the pot has the protruding lips and eyes that are also commonly found on their sculpted figures and masks.
title: Vessel
